egitekotan egon is a paraphrase of 'it is nearly', when combined with behar, it could express weak necessity

the notes categorized the expression as [V....izan] with different inflections of copula verb izan, but the inflections of izan contribute to complementary distribution of allowed contexts, so I divide the expression into [daiteke/liteke]
daiteke is prs.subj.pot.3sg of izan
this is the pot.3pl of izan, it is noted that this is the same as daiteke, only personal inflection is different
zaitezke is the prs.pot.2sg of izan, and dazake is prs.pot.3sg.erg I put them under the same since it seems the only difference is the personal and case marker
this is glossed as be.potential.2sg
this is glossed as prs.subj.pot.3pl
liteke is 3sg irealis hypothetical inflection of izan
(ba) is an optional hypothetical marker
litezke is the plural form of liteke
ez is a negation word
